quizlist.question: You are fighting a fire in the electrical switchboard in the engine room. You should secure the power, then __________.?
quizlist.option3: use a portable dry powder extinguisher

quizlist.question: Fire hose stations shall be marked in red letters and figures such as Fire Station No. '1', '2', '3', etc. The height of the letters and figures must be at least __________.?
quizlist.option3: 3 in

quizlist.question: When two fire hose teams are attacking a fire they should __________.?
quizlist.option1: not attack the fire from opposite sides
quizlist.option3: use fire hoses of different sizes

quizlist.question: A safety ring pin is usually inserted in the handle of a CO2 fire extinguisher to prevent________ .?
quizlist.option2: the cylinder valve from coming loose
quizlist.option3: the handle from contacting the cylinder

quizlist.question: After an engine is started you should __________.?
quizlist.option1: check operating pressures and temperatures, and check for leaks
quizlist.option2: increase engine speed to insure adequate flow of oil to all parts of the engine
quizlist.option3: pay no attention unless there are unusual noises from the engine

quizlist.question: A good approach to personnel safety is to assume that all tanks and pump rooms are potentially dangerous. You should immediately leave an area whenever________.?
quizlist.option1: any of the above conditions occur
quizlist.option2: you have irritation of the eyes, nose, or throat
quizlist.option3: you smell an unusual odor

quizlist.question: Before using a fixed CO2 system to fight an engine room fire, you must __________.?
quizlist.option3: secure the tools

quizlist.question: To prevent the spread of fire by convection you should __________.?
quizlist.option1: close all openings to the area
quizlist.option3: remove combustibles from direct exposure

quizlist.question: Which statement is TRUE of a gasoline spill?
quizlist.option1: It is visible for a shorter time than a fuel oil spill.
quizlist.option2: It does little harm to marine life.
quizlist.option3: It is not covered by the pollution laws.

quizlist.question: Each fireman's outfit and its spare equipment on a tankship must be stowed in a(n) __________.?
quizlist.option2: locked cabinet in the machinery space
quizlist.option3: unlocked cabinet in the machinery space

quizlist.question: Each hand portable fire extinguisher must be marked with __________.?
quizlist.option2: the name of the vessel on which it is located
quizlist.option3: the date that it was installed

quizlist.question: When instructing a crew member concerning the right way to lift a weight, you would instruct him to __________.?
quizlist.option1: bend his knees and lift with his legs
quizlist.option2: arch the back to add strength to the muscles
quizlist.option3: bend his back and stoop

quizlist.question: One of the limitations of foam as an extinguishing agent is that foam_____.?
quizlist.option2: is corrosive and a hazard to fire fighters
quizlist.option3: is heavier than oil and sinks below its surface

quizlist.question: The maximum number of personnel allowed on a personnel transfer basket is __________.?
What do oil discharge in large quantities form which affect birds at sea and may strand on beaches if these  do not disperse into the water as water droplets before reaching shore?
quizlist.option3: spills

quizlist.question: To treat a person suffering from heat exhaustion, you should __________.?
quizlist.option1: Give him sips of cool water
quizlist.option3: Put him in a tub of ice water

quizlist.question: What is a contingency plan for ships?
quizlist.option3: Loading plan for general cargo

quizlist.question: If heavy smoke is coming from the paint locker, what should be the FIRST firefighting response?
quizlist.option2: Enter and use a portable extinguisher
quizlist.option3: Open the door to evaluate the extent of the fire

quizlist.question: How does low expansion foam act as an extinguishing agent when dealing with oil fires?
quizlist.option1: By smothering and also providing some cooling
quizlist.option3: The heat from the fire causes the foam to produce an inert gas which gradually extinguishes the fire.

quizlist.question: The scuppers had been plugged as required at the time an oil spill occurs on deck. After shutting down the transfer, the engineroom should first be informed and then __________.?
quizlist.option1: spread an absorbent material, such as sawdust
quizlist.option2: rig a fire hose and call for water on deck
quizlist.option3: remove the plugs from the scuppers

quizlist.question: Small oil spills on deck can be kept from going overboard by ______:?
quizlist.option2: driving wooden plugs into the vents
quizlist.option3: closing the lids on the vents

quizlist.question: When instructing a crew member concerning the rightv way to lift a weight, you would instruct him to __________.?
quizlist.option1: bend his knees and lift with his legs
quizlist.option2: arch the back to add strength to the muscles
quizlist.option3: bend his back and stoop

quizlist.question: Fire hose couplings __________.?
quizlist.option1: are made of bronze, brass, or soft alloy metals
quizlist.option2: should be painted red in order to identify hose lengths
quizlist.option3: are specially hardened to prevent crushing

quizlist.question: In order to discharge a CO2 portable fire extinguisher, the operator must FIRST __________.?
quizlist.option3: squeeze the two trigger handles together

quizlist.question: The primary concern in aiding a back injury patient is __________.?
quizlist.option1: Avoiding possible injury to the spinal cord by incorrect handling
quizlist.option2: Relieving the patient's pain by giving aspirin or stronger medication
quizlist.option3: Preventing convulsions and muscle spasms caused by the pain

quizlist.question: Each hand portable fire extinguisher must be marked with __________.?
quizlist.option2: the name of the vessel on which it is located
quizlist.option3: the date that it was installed

quizlist.question: If you have a fire in the engine room, your first act should be to __________.?
quizlist.option1: secure the fuel supply and ventilation to the engine room.
quizlist.option2: discharge the fixed CO2 system into the engine room
quizlist.option3: maneuver your vessel into the wind

quizlist.question: Control of fire should be addressed __________.?
quizlist.option3: following control of flooding

quizlist.question: Which statement is TRUE of a gasoline spill?
quizlist.option1: It is visible for a shorter time than aIt is visible for a shorter time than a fuel oil spill.
quizlist.option2: It does little harm to marine life.
quizlist.option3: It is not covered by the pollution laws.

quizlist.question: To ensure the early and efficient collection and exchange of security-related information is one of the objectives of_______.?
quizlist.option3: MARPOL

quizlist.question: The number and type of hand portable fire extinguishers required outside and in the vicinity of the paint locker exit is __________.?
quizlist.option3: two A-IIs

quizlist.question: In order to discharge a CO2 portable fire extinguisher, the operator must FIRST __________.?
quizlist.option3: squeeze the two trigger handles together

quizlist.question: When administering first aid, what should you avoid?
quizlist.option1: Unnecessary haste and appearance of uncertainty
quizlist.option3: Instructing bystanders

quizlist.question: Since electrical burn victims may be in shock, the FIRST medical response is to check for __________.?
quizlist.option3: Indication of broken bones

quizlist.question: To prevent the spread of fire by convection you should __________.?
quizlist.option1: close all openings to the area
quizlist.option3: remove combustibles from direct exposure

quizlist.question: When oil is discharged overboard, an entry is required in the __________.?
quizlist.option3: engine rough log

quizlist.question: If you observe any situation which presents a safety or pollution hazard during fuel transfer operations which action should you take first?
quizlist.option2: Wait for the person-in- charge to act.
quizlist.option3: Notify the ballast control operator.

quizlist.question: Before using a fixed CO2 system to fight an engine room fire, you must __________.?
quizlist.option3: secure the tools

quizlist.question: Injuries resulting from slips and falls constitute the largest percentage of accidents that occur in the catering department. What shall be done to reduce this high accident rate?
quizlist.option1: Keep the floors and decks free from fat and grease.
quizlist.option2: Ensure that slippery substances are not left where several persons are expected to be around.
quizlist.option3: Install thermostat to avoid water from freezing to ice.

quizlist.question: What is the primary concern in aiding a back injury patient ?
quizlist.option1: Avoiding possible injury to the spinal cord by incorrect handling
quizlist.option2: Relieving the patient's pain by giving aspirin or stronger medication
quizlist.option3: Preventing convulsions and muscle spasms caused by the pain

quizlist.question: A precaution you should take before bunkering is to __________ ?
quizlist.option3: plug the sounding pipes

quizlist.question: After an engine is started you should __________.?
quizlist.option1: check operating pressures and temperatures, and check for leaks
quizlist.option2: increase engine speed to insure adequate flow of oil to all parts of the engine
quizlist.option3: pay no attention unless there are unusual noises from the engine

quizlist.question: If heavy smoke is coming from the paint locker, what should be the FIRST firefighting response?
quizlist.option2: Enter and use a portable extinguisher
quizlist.option3: Open the door to evaluate the extent of the fire

quizlist.question: A safety outlet is provided on the CO2 discharge piping to prevent_________ .?
quizlist.option1: over pressurization of the CO2 discharge piping
quizlist.option2: over pressurization of the space being flooded
quizlist.option3: rupture of cylinder due to temperature increase

quizlist.question: Each fireman's outfit and its spare equipment on a tankship must be stowed in __________.?
quizlist.option2: locked cabinet in the machinery space
quizlist.option3: unlocked cabinet in the machinery space

quizlist.question: What equipment must be on a life float? (small passenger vessel regulations)?
quizlist.option1: Two paddles, a light, painter, lifeline and pendants
quizlist.option3: Water-light and painter only

quizlist.question: If you observe any situation which presents a safety or pollution hazard during fuel transfer operations which action should you take first?
quizlist.option2: Close the valves at the manifold.
quizlist.option3: Notify the person in charge of the shore facility.

quizlist.question: Since electrical burn victims may be in shock, the FIRST medical response is to check for __________.?
quizlist.option3: Indication of broken bones

quizlist.question: There is a fire aft aboard your vessel. To help fight the fire, you should put the __________.?
quizlist.option1: Bow into the wind and decrease speed
quizlist.option3: Stern into the wind and increase speed

quizlist.question: A precaution you should take before bunkering is to __________?
quizlist.option3: plug the sounding pipes

quizlist.question: When administering first aid you should avoid __________.?
quizlist.option1: Unnecessary haste and appearance of uncertainty
quizlist.option3: Instructing bystanders

quizlist.question: Fire in an engine compartment is best extinguished with carbon dioxide gas (CO2) and by__________.?
quizlist.option2: leaving the compartment open to the air
quizlist.option3: closing the compartment except for the ventilators

quizlist.question: A patient in shock should NOT be placed in which position?
quizlist.option3: Head down and feet up, no injuries to face or head

quizlist.question: The number and type of hand portable fire extinguishers required outside and in the vicinity of the paint locker exit is __________.?
quizlist.option3: two A-IIs

quizlist.question: Fire hose stations shall be marked in red letters and figures such as Fire Station No. 1, 2, 3 and others. The height of the letters and figures must be at least __________.?
quizlist.option3: 4 cm

quizlist.question: What equipment must be on a life float? (small passenger vessel regulations)?
quizlist.option1: Two paddles, a light, painter, lifeline and pendants
quizlist.option3: Water-light and painter only

quizlist.question: The spread of fire is prevented by __________.?
quizlist.option1: removing combustibles from the endangered area
quizlist.option2: heating surfaces adjacent to the fire
quizlist.option3: heating surfaces adjacent to the fire

quizlist.question: Control of fire should be addressed __________.?
quizlist.option3: following control of flooding

quizlist.question: Which activity will have the greatest fire-fighting effect in case of a fire?
quizlist.option3: All possible fire-fighting equipment is brought to the scene

quizlist.question: Which fire-fighting equipment is most efficient and with least side effects in case of a large fire in the engine room?
quizlist.option1: Central gas extinguishing system and/or water fog.
quizlist.option3: Sprinkler system

quizlist.question: Which of the following is NOT TRUE why there may not be enough oxygen in an enclosed space or tank?
quizlist.option1: Enclosed space has no proper circulation of air.
quizlist.option2: Cargo inside may have absorb the oxygen.
quizlist.option3: Oxygen is depleted as oxidation may have taken place.

quizlist.question: Which extinguishing agent is the best for use on electrical fires?
quizlist.option3: Water fog

quizlist.question: How do you treat a person suffering from heat exhaustion?
quizlist.option1: Give him sips of cool water
quizlist.option3: Put him in a tub of ice water

quizlist.question: When bunkering is complete, the hoses should be__________.?
quizlist.option1: drained, blanked off, and stored securely
quizlist.option3: washed out with hot soapy water

quizlist.question: You are fighting a fire in the electrical switchboard in the engine room. You should secure the power, then __________.?
quizlist.option3: use a low-velocity fog adapter with the fire hose

quizlist.question: What is the most important consideration when determining how to fight an electrical fire?
quizlist.option2: Whether the fire is in machinery or passenger spaces
quizlist.option3: The amount of toxic fumes created by the extinguisher

quizlist.question: What is the most important consideration when determining how to fight an electrical fire?
quizlist.option2: Whether the fire is in machinery or passenger spaces
quizlist.option3: The amount of toxic fumes created by the extinguisher

quizlist.question: Before CPR is started, you should ____________.?
quizlist.option3: treat any bleeding wounds

quizlist.question: The maximum number of personnel allowed on a personnel transfer basket is __________.?
The spread of fire is prevented by __________.?
quizlist.option1: removing combustibles from the endangered area
quizlist.option2: heating surfaces adjacent to the fire
quizlist.option3: heating surfaces adjacent to the fire

quizlist.option3: spills

quizlist.question: A liquid, as listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet MSDS, having a flash point below 37.78Â°C is called ________ .?
quizlist.option3: viscous liquid

quizlist.option1: Enclosed space has no proper circulation of air.
quizlist.option2: Cargo inside may have absorb the oxygen.
quizlist.option3: Oxygen is depleted as oxidation may have taken place.

quizlist.question: A health hazard term listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) that indicates allergic-like reaction in some people after repeated exposure is _____________.?
quizlist.option3: oxidizer

quizlist.option2: leaving the compartment open to the air
quizlist.option3: closing the compartment except for the ventilators

quizlist.question: There is a fire aft aboard your vessel. To help fight the fire, you should put the __________.?
quizlist.option1: Bow into the wind and decrease speed
quizlist.option3: Stern into the wind and increase speed

quizlist.question: Fire and abandon ship stations and duties may be found in the __________.?
quizlist.option3: crewman's duty list

quizlist.option2: locked cabinet in the machinery space
quizlist.option3: unlocked cabinet in the machinery space

quizlist.option1: Avoiding possible injury to the spinal cord by incorrect handling

quizlist.option3: Preventing convulsions and muscle spasms caused by the pain

quizlist.option2: Enter and use a portable extinguisher

quizlist.question: The scuppers had been plugged as required at the time an oil spill occurs on deck. After shutting down the transfer, the engineroom should first be informed and then __________.?
quizlist.option1: spread an absorbent material, such as sawdust

quizlist.option3: remove the plugs from the scuppers

quizlist.question: One of the requirements for an oil tanker operating with Dedicated Clean Ballast shall be that it is equipped with_________.?
quizlist.option3: Crude Oil Washing

quizlist.question: When two fire hose teams are attacking a fire they should __________.?
quizlist.option1: not attack the fire from opposite sides
quizlist.option3: use fire hoses of different sizes

quizlist.question: When oil is discharged overboard, an entry is required in the __________.?
quizlist.option3: Official Logbook

quizlist.option1: are made of bronze, brass, or soft alloy metals
quizlist.option2: should be painted red in order to identify hose lengths
quizlist.option3: are specially hardened to prevent crushing

quizlist.option3: 3 cm

quizlist.option1: drained, blanked off, and stored securely
quizlist.option3: washed out with hot soapy water

quizlist.option2: leaving the compartment open to the air

quizlist.question: A patient in shock should NOT be placed in which position?
quizlist.option3: Head down and feet up, no injuries to face or head

quizlist.option1: secure the fuel supply and ventilation to the engine room.

quizlist.option3: maneuver your vessel into the wind

quizlist.question: If you observe any situation which presents a safety or pollution hazard during fuel transfer operations on a MODU (Mobile Offshore Drilling Unit), which of the listed actions should be taken first?
quizlist.option2: Wait for the person-in- charge to act
quizlist.option3: Notify the ballast control operator

quizlist.question: A chemical material, as listed on a Material Safety Data Sheet that reacts with water or moist air, and produces a health or physical hazard, is called _______ .?
quizlist.option3: flammable

quizlist.question: What is the line roughly following the 180th meridian called?
quizlist.option3: Equator

quizlist.question: Which of the following is false why there may not be enough oxygen in an enclosed space or tank?
quizlist.option1: Enclosed space has no proper circulation of air.
quizlist.option2: Enclosed space has proper circulation of air
quizlist.option3: Enclosed space has high oxygen content

quizlist.question: For the safety of personnel working with fire hoses, fire pumps are fitted with ____________.?
quizlist.option1: pressure gage and relief valve on the discharge side
quizlist.option2: butterfly valve on the discharge side
quizlist.option3: air priming valve on the impeller housing

quizlist.question: Which statement is FALSE regarding Halon as a fire extinguishing agent?
quizlist.option3: It destroys the ozone layer
